body:
To better communicate what this project is trying to achieve, I should describe it in terms of guiding values and what I want to achieve with it. Some things that come to mind:

- be accessible & approachable - games are for everyone
- let players create stories
- bring people together
- encourage positive experiences
- support creativity

comments.body: Also: why am I doing this? To see what I can do, free of time constraints. To follow my perfectionism. To reshape things. Quality. Being relatable.

I might call these core values "tenets"...

* I don't want to have grinding. No bars to fill. No XP, no money. There will be mods for those. But I want to see (and show) how a world of abundance can look like.
    * binary progression, analogue mechanics
* Make it easy to do things right, for both players and modders
* Simulate all the things

I could also cite some influences to communicate some of the feeling I'm going for:
- Jedi Academy, obviously (basically everything)
- Dishonored (rule-driven responsive semi-predictable AI, powers, interactivity)
- Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance (Cutting)
- Devil May Cry 3-5 (combat system, rating system, camera system)
- Souls Games (weapon-specific animations & AI, modular architecture, tilesets & content re-use, katanas)
- Roblox, though I never played it (creating, sharing)
- Second Life (player-created content, interaction)
- VR Chat
- Project Offset (destruction)
- Spore (creature designer, procedural animation)
- QWOP (physics-based movement)
- Gang Beasts (physics-based animation)
- No Man's Sky (creatures, scale)
- Battlefield 2: Special Forces (grappling hook, zip lines, bots)
- Destiny 2 (co-op, weapon perks, character customisation)
- Star Citizen (walkable ships)
- Beam NG Drive, though I never played it (physics-driven vehicles)
- Star Wars Episode 1 Racer
- Warcraft 3 (level editor)
- Valheim (physics, modern take on low-poly)
- Planet Coaster (voxel terrain, spline-based track editor)
- Crysis (Editor, slide, 0G, physics)
- Prey (2006) (portals, local gravity, wall-walking)
- Half-Life: Alyx (VR interactions, editor, workshop)
- Supreme Commander (clients simulating in sync, slowing down to wait for the slowest one)
- Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time (rewind)
- Rainbow Six: Vegas 2 (terrorist hunt multiplayer)

Try boiling it down to one sentence.

TheseusJA is about sharing and cooperating with other people and fostering communities.

title: Document Core Values & Goals
